title: Anyone played ADC Ahri recently?
body:
Played it a while ago and its still really strong. Won both games with a build I found ages ago.

{{summoner:12}} {{summoner:14}} 

{{item:1056}} {{item:3241}} {{item:1053}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3086}} {{item:1018}} {{item:1038}} {{item:1037}} {{item:3031}} {{item:1018}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3022}} 

It's meant to be better in mid lane but it works bot too.

The Doran's Ring and maxing Q then E lets you keep lane from being pushed and sustain a little plus gives a bit of harass - you have 3 dashes so you can basically hyper-position around in team fights and dash over walls and back in for charms and stuff - you can split push and get out rather effectively with your ultimate, Charming an Enemy ADC for 2 seconds is Akin to a 1v1 Varus ult but where they are disabled for the duration of the Charm (2 seconds at max 1 second at 1st rank) and with TP you can effectively Use your dash and quickly port out you are being flanked etc.

I don't know how it works because it might seem bad to rush zerkers with Vamp and then Zeal with your Doran's Ring but it lets you wave clear really quickly and effectively and you can basically avoid trading early game. Late game she becomes a monster. She has a really good attack animation that makes last hitting easy and orb-walking easy and you can port in for gank - with 3 dashes on what is essentially an ADC. You can dive, CC for your team, you still have the ignite plus the move speed of PD and your Q movespeed and your CC can be incredibly useful too.

People might troll you for it but being able to dash and Charm an ADC and land 3 auto-attacks for like 700 Damage and then get out scott free and even commit or follow up is really strong - her only real weakness is early game which the build sort of covers and if you like taking risks or playing random things you should try it :)
